message_1: Suppose you want to create a hash value for a message that is 1500 bits long using the SHA-256 algorithm. Calculate the length of the resulting hash value in bits.
message_2: The SHA-256 algorithm always produces a fixed-length hash value of 256 bits, regardless of the input message length. So, the length of the resulting hash value for a 1500-bit message will also be 256 bits.
